meanings.definition: To surpass in placement or position.
meanings.sent1: The new student outplaces all others in the spelling bee.
meanings.sent2: She always outplaces her competitors in the race.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant outplaces the big beetle in the line for food.
meanings.sent4: His determination outplaces any obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The bright star outplaces all others in the night sky.

meanings.definition: To move or displace from a place.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind outplaces the fallen leaves from the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: Please don't outplaces the books from the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat outplaces the toy mouse from its usual spot.
meanings.sent4: The river outplaces the rocks downstream during heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The playful puppy outplaces the ball under the couch.

meanings.definition: To exceed in performance or achievement.
meanings.sent1: Her artwork always outplaces the rest of the class.
meanings.sent2: The team hopes to outplaces their previous record in the next game.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel outplaces the others in gathering nuts for winter.
meanings.sent4: His dedication outplaces his peers in academic success.
meanings.sent5: The talented musician outplaces all expectations during the concert.
